pull.title: test: Run mempool_compatibility.py with MiniWallet
pull.body: By using the already existing miniwallet, the test can be run even when no wallet is compiled.

issue.title: tests: Run both descriptor and legacy tests within a single test invocation
issue.body: Instead of having the tests only do one type or the other, depending on command line arguments, these tests should be running with both types of wallets. Any test that calls `add_wallet_options` will be run for each wallet type that it specifies a wallet option for if none are give in the command line. If a particular wallet is specified with `--legacy-wallet` or `--descriptors`, the options are still respected.

events.body: It doesn't matter if the txs are descendants/ancestors of each other, so I just did that to make the diff even smaller.

ACK fa43f60a0c24880bf4802c74890644ae785bec7d
- AFAICT code in test does effectively the same thing as before
- test still runs when I disable wallet
- test still passes normally, fails if I delete certain line of `LoadMempool` or `DumpMempool`
